data.title: Studded Hakkapeliittas / Nokian Tires
data.meta_description: Road traffic entered an era of motorways and asphalt. Tyres became the main product for Suomen Kumitehdas.
data.text:
Road traffic entered an era of motorways and asphalt. Tires became the main product for Suomen Kumitehdas. Road safety in winter was a hot topic of discussion, and fiery debate went on about the need for studded tires and speed limits. The sales of winter tires were driven forward by a new Government Decree on motor vehicles that determined the minimum tread depth for tires for the first time.

Suomen Kumitehdas took the initiative in using skid stoppers in winter tires. The chosen partner was Kovametalli Oy from Helsinki, and the Kometa studs developed in cooperation with Kovametalli entered the market in 1957.

The Haka-Hakkapeliitta tire was converted into a new type, Kometa-Hakkapeliitta, that had holes for studs. In 1965, all tires by Nokian Tyres could be bought with stud holes. The new introduction for that year, the Hakkapeliitta, was the first winter tire specially designed for studding.

Nokian Kumiviesti, the customer magazine of the rubber factory, campaigned for safe stud installation. All the tires on the car needed studding, and studs needed to be placed along different lines.

The strong legacy of Suomen Kumitehdas entered a new phase, when the conglomerate Oy Nokia Ab was born in 1967. The merger joined together the wood processing company Nokia Oy, Suomen Kaapelitehdas and Suomen Kumitehdas. The Kumitehdas logo became the symbol of the company.
